titlestmt.titleproper: Arthur Dannenberg Warl War II ration book undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Arthur Dannenberg Warl War II ration book

bioghist.p: Arthur Mansbach Dannenberg (1891-1990) was a pediatrician. Dannenberg graduated from the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine in 1913. He was an intern at Jewish Hospital (now known as the Albert Einstein Medical Center). From 1938 until his retirement in 1968, Dannenberg was chief of pediatrics at the Center. Dannenberg was a member of the Philadelphia County Medical Society, the American Medical Association, and the American Academy of Pediatrics and was a president of the Philadelphia Pediatric Society. He was a Fellow of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia and a member of the Council, serving on the Finance Committee.

scopecontent.p: This is a World War II ration book belonging to Arthur M. Dannenberg, dating from the 1940s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
